instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
Hi I have macbook Air 2020 motherboard <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> the keyboard light does not turn on and the laptop does not sleep when closing the lcd and no longer turns on when opening the laptop. the problem started when i was changing the lcd, i connected the lcd without disconnecting the battery. he broke a coil, and cut some tracks, I see that it is difficult to find the brd, if someone has one on the bench, he could help with the trails. 
I need see probe points near <CHIP>U6500</CHIP> besides lcd connector.
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: That coil has trace going to LCD connector?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: yes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
Probably webcam not working, supposing is the 5V ALSCAM rail (L8570).
That means ALS is also not powered; good reason for non working keyboard backlight.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
webcam initially didn’t work 
Now is working

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
after replacing coil webcam works 
But still no keyboard light

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
Check if ALS works.
Tap webcam and see if screen backlight reacts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: Screen backlight don’t reacts

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
When you have a problem with Ambient Light Sensor (ALS), the keyboard backlight doesn't work in such case.
Check traces for ALS to LCD connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: I can’t check traces because I don’t have other motherboard to copy. Do you have one to help see continuity with multimeter?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: I can’t check traces because I don’t have other motherboard to copy. Do you have one to help see continuity with multimeter?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: Sorry, I don't have this model...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: No members to help this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
Pins 34 & 36 of J8500 go to resistors <RESISTOR>R8555</RESISTOR>/56 (33 ohm).
You should find them.

Start checking diode mode to ground on both lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: You meant <RESISTOR>R8556</RESISTOR>/58

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
The resistors are good 
No shorted to the ground

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
Yeah, sorry for mistyping.

You should get the same diode mode reading on both lines; I didn't ask for short.
And check their continuity with J8500.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R8556</RESISTOR>/58 has continuity with J8500

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
"You should get the same diode mode reading on both lines; I didn't ask for short."
Can we get the exact readings???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: Both lines has 425 ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
"i was changing the lcd"
New chinese assembly?
It doesn't have the ALS, as usual for chinese bulshits...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
No new lcd
I took from other laptop
The original is broken

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: You should test this one with other board, to be sure its ALS is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
i Will connect original broken lcd and connect to external monitor and test.
O don’t have other working board to test

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: I put the old LCD on and to my surprise the keyboard light came on. the broken lcd belongs to core i5 2020 not M1 the good lcd is 2018

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: So there is an issue with ALS from the replacement screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: i tested other 2018 same result

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
You get KB backlight with original display, so there is ALS issue for sure.
Maybe compatibility issue, find the exact year screen assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: Where to buy original parts ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: I was comparing j8500 of both schematics(<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) where I tested the LCDs,J8500 same all points even  ALS same .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message:
Don't waste time checking on the board; you can generate other damage instead.
Nothing wrong there, if you get KB backlight with original screen assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard light
threads.message: 2018 doesn't have True Tone, 2019 and 2020 have True Tone. It seems they are not interchangeable. Extremely hard to buy good LCD assemblies for these machines. Mostly garbage on the market. Get it replaced at Apple.
